get.description: Returns DocumentReferences based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size & _pretty are query parameters used for Paging).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the DocumentReference. Sample ids are: 4715, 2984, 10866, 5083, 10869.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: authenticator
parameters.description: Who/What authenticated the document (Organization, Practitioner).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Who and/or what authored the document (Device, Patient, Organization, Practitioner, RelatedPerson).

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Categorization of Document. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Document creation time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Document creation time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: custodian
parameters.description: Org which maintains the document (Organization).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Human-readable description (title).

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Context of the document content

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Main Clinical Acts Documented. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: facility
parameters.description: Kind of facility where patient was seen. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format/content rules for the document. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Master Version Specific Identifier. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: indexed
parameters.description: When this document reference created. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: indexed
parameters.description: When this document reference created. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Human language of the content (BCP-47). Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Uri where the data can be found.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who|what is the subject of the document (Patient).

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time of service that is being documented. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time of service that is being documented. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: related-id
parameters.description: Identifer of related objects or events.Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: related-ref
parameters.description: Related Resource.

parameters.name: relatesto
parameters.description: Target of the relationship (DocumentReference).

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description: replaces | transforms | signs | appends. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: relationship
parameters.description: Combination of relation and relatesTo. Value should be in the form: [relation]$[relatesTo]

parameters.name: securitylabel
parameters.description: Document security-tags . Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: setting
parameters.description: Additional details about where the content was created . Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: current | superseded | entered in error. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Who|what is the subject of the document (Device, Patient, Practitioner, Group).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Kind of document. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: DocumentReference resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of DocumentReference resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

get.description: Search the specified resource type in DocumentReference compartment.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the DocumentReference. Sample ids are: 4715, 2984, 10866, 5083, 10869.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of Resource

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the DocumentReference. Sample ids are: 4715, 2984, 10866, 5083, 10869.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the resource. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular resource, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes. 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.
